intro: Hieracium abakurae, commonly known as the Abakura hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
